noun.name: skis
noun.discription: a pair of long, narrow strips of hard material attached to boots, used for sliding over snow

object1.name: surfboard
object1.discription: in parallel with 'skis', is a long, flat board used to ride on the surface of the water while standing up

object2.name: snowboard
object2.discription: in parallel with 'skis', is a single, wide board that is ridden in a surfing position, used for sliding down snow-covered slopes

object3.name: rollerblades
object3.discription: in parallel with 'skis', are a type of inline skates with a boot and wheels, used for gliding on smooth surfaces

object4.name: skateboard
object4.discription: in parallel with 'skis', is a narrow, short platform with wheels, used for performing tricks and riding on smooth surfaces

object5.name: bicycle
object5.discription: in parallel with 'skis', is a two-wheeled vehicle powered by pedaling, used for transportation and recreation

object6.name: scooter
object6.discription: in parallel with 'skis', is a small, motorized or kick-powered vehicle with two wheels, used for short-distance travel

object7.name: sled
object7.discription: in parallel with 'skis', is a flat, lightweight vehicle without wheels, used for sliding over snow or ice

object8.name: ice skates
object8.discription: in parallel with 'skis', are shoes with metal blades attached, used for gliding over ice surfaces
